titles.title: Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Dǝrsanä Mikaʾel, Homiliary for the feasts of St. Michael (fols. 5ra-127va) I-1) Introduction (fol. 5ra-va) I-2) Homily by Timothy (Dämatewos), Patriarch of Alexandria for the 12th of Ḫǝdar (fols. 5va-12rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 12rb); miracle (fols. 12va-vb, 15ra-vb) I-3) Homily by an anonymous author [for Taḫśaś] (fols. 16ra-21va); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 21va l. 13-vb); miracle (fols. 21vb-22va) I-4) Homily [by Epiphanius, Metropolitan of Cyprus] for Ṭǝrr (fols. 22va-vb, 27ra-36rb); ʾarke-hymn (fol. 36rb); miracle (fols. 36rb-37ra); I-5) Homily by an anonymous author for Yäkkatit (fols. 37ra-38vb, 41ra-42vb); miracle (fols. 42vb-43va). I-6) Homily by [Severus] Patriarch of Antiochia for the 12th of Mäggabit (fols. 43vb-44vb, 47ra-60ra); miracle (fols. 60ra-61rb). I-7) Homily [by Metropolitan Yoḥannǝs the Orthodox] for Miyazya (fols. 61rb-62vb, 69ra-71ra); miracle (fols. 71ra-72va). I-8) Homily by Yoḥannǝs, Metropolitan of Egypt and Ethiopia for Gǝnbot (fols. 72va-vb, 77ra-78ra); miracle (fols. 78ra-79rb); I-9) Homily by Mikaʾel [Yoḥannǝs], Metropolitan of ʾAksum (ʾAkusǝm) for Säne (fols. 79rb-80vb, 87ra-91ra); commemorative notice (fols. 91ra-96vb); miracle (fols. 96vb-97va) I-10) Homily by Patriarch [Metropolitan] Yoḥannǝs] for Ḥamle (fols. 97va-98vb (?), 101ra-103va); miracle (fols. 103va-104rb). I-11) Homily by an anonymous author for Näḥase (fols. 104rb-vb, 108ra-111rb); miracle (fols. 111rb-112ra) I-12) Homily by an anonymous author for Mäskäräm (fols. 112ra-vb, 115ra-116va); miracle (fols. 116va-118ra) I-13) Homily by an anonymous author for Ṭǝqǝmt (fols. 118ra-vb, 123ra-125va); miracle (fols. 125va-127va).
Additiones 1-5.

copyists.copyist: Kǝnfä Mikaʾel is mentioned as he scribe in the concluding formula on fol. 127va.

donors.donor: The name of ʿAmdä Mikaʾel is written in the supplication formulas in the main hand. In many cases (esp. at the beginning of the text) his name has been erased and replaced with that of Sǝbḥat Lä-ʾAb. This name is also mentioned in the commemorative notices which were added on blank folios at a later stage (s. Additio 1). According to Additio 3, Wäldä Mikaʾel commissioned the writing. This note includes also the name of Sǝbḥat Lä-ʾAb. According to the more recent Additio 4, the Ms. was purchased and donated to the church by ras Sǝbḥat ʾArägawi (1844-1914).

txstates.txstate: The Ms. has been resewn. The leather cover has been cut off from the spine and partly from the front board. Boards attachments have been carefully repaired. Holes or tears (carefully) amended on fols. 49, 95.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled eather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 9 tools were used: double line fillet, double circle, cross hatching, hatching, corni form, small x, x-form, swirl, wave form).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – II(2/fols. 13r-14v) – ፪III(8/fols. 15r-22v) – IV(4/fols. 23r-26v) – V(8/fols. 27r-34v) – VI(10/fols. 35r-44v) – VII(2/fols. 45r-46v) – VIII(8/fols. 47r-54v) – IX(8/fols. 55r-62v) – X(6/fols. 63r-68v) – XI(12/fols. 69r-80v) – XII(6/fols. 81r-86v) – XIII(8/fols. 87r-94v) – XIV(10/fols. 95r-104v) – XV(4/fols. 105r-108v) – XVI(10/fols. 109r-118v) – XVII(4/fols. 119r-122v) – XVIII(5; s.l. 1, stub after 5/fols. 123r-127v)

taunit.rl-info:
Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/B. Primary pricks are visible Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Leaves containing the minatures are unruled.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the donor; groups of lines on the incipit page of the text and on some incipit pages of sections, incipit of sections and subsections; monthly readings in the upper margin, notes in the bottom margin; elements of the punctuation signs and of the chapter dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.

otherdetails.otherdetail: The introduction (Text I-1) is usually part of the homily for Ḫǝdar. The miracles are numbered.

additional.add:
Fols. 1ra-2rb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Ḫǝdar and ˀarke-hymn.
Fol. 4va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Taḫśaś.
Fol. 14va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Ṭǝrr and ˀarke-hymn.
Fol. 24va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Yäkkatit and ˀarke-hymn.
Fol. 26va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Mäggabit and ˀarke-hymn.
Fol. 40va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Ḥamle.
Fol. 46va-vb: Commemorative notice for Miyazya and ˀarke-hymn.
Fol. 63ra-rb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Gǝnbot and ˀarke-hymn.
Fols. 66va-67rb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Säne.
Fol. 86va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Näḥase and ˀarke-hymn.
Fol. 100va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Mäskäräm.
Fol. 120va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Ṭǝqǝmt.
Fols. 1ra-2rb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Ḫǝdar and ˀarke-hymn.
Fol. 4va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Taḫśaś.
Fol. 14va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Ṭǝrr and ˀarke-hymn.
Fol. 24va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Yäkkatit and ˀarke-hymn.
Fol. 26va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Mäggabit and ˀarke-hymn.
Fol. 40va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Ḥamle.
Fol. 46va-vb: Commemorative notice for Miyazya and ˀarke-hymn.
Fol. 63ra-rb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Gǝnbot and ˀarke-hymn.
Fols. 66va-67rb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Säne.
Fol. 86va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Näḥase and ˀarke-hymn.
Fol. 100va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Mäskäräm.
Fol. 120va-vb: Commemorative notice for the 12th of Ṭǝqǝmt.
additional.det: Quire A as well as blank folios after or before the miniatures were used to add the missing commemorative notices and hymns. The commemorative notice for Ḫǝdar includes a part of the homily for Taḫśaś (from fol. 2rb l. 12 onwards). Sǝbḥat lä-ʾAb is mentioned in the supplication formulas of all commemorative notices. The same hand added the name of Sǝbḥat lä-ʾAb to the supplication formulas throughout the Ms.

additional.cont: Fol. 84r: Supplication for the painter.
additional.tran: Fol. 84r: I, Wäldä Maryam, appeal for your protection on my knees.

additional.det: The note states that Wäldä Mikaʾel is the commissioner, and lists names of the members of his family. In addition, several names including Sǝbḥat lä-ʾAb are written on fol. 2rb, in the same hand.
The note, written in a recent hand, mentions ras Sǝbḥat (1844-1914) as the donor.

additional.cont: Fol. 127v (bottom margin): Note on healing a blind man.
additional.det: The note, in Amharic, is probably written in the main hand. It might refer to a miniature contained in this Ms.

extras.extra: - The scribe sometimes disregards the ruling lines (e.g., fols. 48r-54v). - Notes referring to the homilies' content are written in the bottom margin, in the main hand: fol. 22vb, 44vb, 61rb, 72vb, 79rb, 97va, 104rb, 112ra, 118ra. - Pen trial: fols. 5r, 79v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - An undecorated quire mark is written in the left upper corner of fol. 16r: ፪ (second leaf of the quire).

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months, written in the upper margin, - in the main hand (in red): ዘታኅሣሥ: fol. 21va ዘጥር: fol. 22va ዘየካቲት: fol. 37ra ዘመጋቢት: fol. 43vb ዘሚዝያ[sic]: fol. 61rb ዘግንቦት: fol. 72va ዘሰኔ: fol. 79rb ዘሰኔ: fol. 91ra ዘሐምሌ: fol.97va (crossed out) ዘነሐሴ: fol. 104rb ዘመስከረም: fol. 112 ዘጥቅምት: fol. 118ra; - in secondary hands: ዘኅዳር፡ ስንክሳር: fol. 1ra ዘኅዳር: fol. 12va ዘታኅሣሥ: fol. 16r.

miniature.info: Fol. 2v: Holy Trinity.
miniature.details: Legends: ሥዕለ፡ ሥላሴ፡ “Image of the Trinity”. ገጸ፡ ሰብእ፡ “Face of a human being”. ገጸ፡ ንስር፡ “Face of an eagle”. [ገጸ፡ አንበሳ፡] “Face of a lion”. [ገጸ፡ ላህም፡] “Face of an ox”.

miniature.info: Fol. 3r: St. Michael with two angels.
miniature.details: Legend: ሥዕለ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወመላእክት፡ “Image of St. Michael and the angels”.

miniature.info: Fol. 4r: St. Michael the Archangel enthroned, surrounded by the angels.
miniature.details: Legend: ከመ፡ ተሰይመ፡ ሊቀ፡ መላእክት፡ ሚካኤል፡ “How St. Michael the Archangel was enthroned”.

miniature.info: Fols. 13v-14r: Diptych.
miniature.details:
St. Michael saves the souls of the faithful on his wings from the power of Satan, prostrate under his feet (the first). Legend: ከመ፡ አውጽኦሙ፡ ለነፍሳት፡ ሚካኤል፡ እምነ፡ ሲኦል፡ “How St. Michael led the souls from Sheol”.
The pure souls in the Paradise (the second). Legend: ወአብዖሙ፡ ውስተ፡ ገነት፡ “And he let them enter into the Paradise”.

miniature.info: Fols. 23v-24r: Diptych: St. Michael helps Därataʿos (Däratawos) and his wife.
miniature.details: Legends on fol. 23v: በከመ፡ ኃዘኑ፡ ደራታዎስ፡ ወበእሲቱ፡ በእንተ፡ ዘአልቦሙ፡ ንዋይ፡ ዘይገብሩ፡ ለበዓለ፡ ሚካኤል፡ “How Därataʿos and his wife were sad because they possessed nothing for the celebration of the feast of St. Michael”. ዘከመ፡ ወሀበቶ፡ ልብሶ፡ ለበዓልለ፡ [sic] በግዕ፡ “How she gave his dresses to the owner of the sheep”. ዘከመ፡ ሤጠ፡ ልብሶ፡ “How he sold his dresses”. ዘከመ፡ ተራከቦ፡ ሚካኤል፡ በፍኖት፡ “How St. Michael met him on the road”. Legends on fol. 24r: ዘከመ፡ ለዓከ፡ ሎቱ፡ መልአከ፡ ኀበ፡ በዓልለ፡ [sic] በግዕ፡ “How the angel sent him towards the owner of the sheep”. ዘከመ፡ አውጽአ፡ ዓሣ፡ እምባሕር፡ “How he pulled out a fish from the sea”. ዘከመ፡ ተሣየጠ፡ ዓሣ፡ ዘበከርሡ፡ ወርቅ፡ “How he bought the fish that had gold in its interior”. ዘከመ፡ ጠብሑ፡ ከርሦ፡ ለዓሣ፡ ቅድመ፡ ሚካኤል፡ “How they cut up the interior of the fish in front of St. Michael”.

miniature.info: Fol. 25r: St. Michael saves a child from a rich neighbour.
miniature.details: Legends: ዘከመ፡ ከአሥጠሞ፡ ባዕል፡ በባሕር፡ “How the rich man immersed him into the sea”. ከመ፡ ወጽአ፡ እምባሕር፡ በእደ፡ ዝ፡ “How he went out from the sea thanks to the hand of this…” (?). ገብርኤል፡ ወሚካኤል፡ ከመ፡ ነገርዎ፡ ለባዕል፡ ከመ፡ ይወርሶ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ሕፃን፡ “How Gabriel and Michael told the rich that the child will inherit it”. እሙ፡ ከመ፡ ሤ <...>

miniature.info: Fol. 25v: A woman (the mother of the child) praying in a church.
miniature.details: The miniature is connected with the previous one on fol. 25r.

miniature.info: Fol. 26r: People carrying letters (?) to the rich man with the help of St. Michael.
miniature.details: The miniature is connected with the two previous on fols. 25r, 25v.

miniature.info: Fol. 39v: Two miniatures.
miniature.details: St. Michael appearing to Samson, who is holding the jawbone (upper part). Legend: ከመ፡ ወሀቦ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ለሶምሶን፡ ኃይለ፡ “How St. Michael gave the strength to Samson”. Samson defeating the Philistines with the jawbone under St. Michael´s protection (lover part). Legend: ሶምሶን፡ ከመ፡ ቀቲሎሙ፡ በመንከሰ፡ አድግ፡ ለኢሎፍላወያን፡ “Samson killed the Philistines by the jawbone of a donkey”.

miniature.info: Fol. 40r: A lazy, poor man demands riches from St. Michael.
miniature.details: Legends: ዘከመ፡ ሰዓሎ፡ ኀካይ፡ ብእሲ፡ ነዳይ፡ ብዕለ፡ ለሚካኤል፡ “How a lazy poor man demanded riches from St. Michael”. ከመ፡ ደለወ፡ ባዕል፡ ወርቀ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ነዳይ፡ ከመ፡ ጸለየ፡ “How the rich man weighted gold of the poor man and how he prayed”. ከመ፡ ተላቅሐ፡ ወርቀ፡ እምባዕል፡ "How the gold was borrowed". ፬፡ ዘረከብዎ፡ “They got 4 times more”. ባዕል፡ “Rich man”. ከመ፡ ኀደገ፡ በባሕር፡ ዘተለቅሐ፡ ወርቀ፡ በሣፅን፡ ከመ፡ ውኅጠ፡ “How he abandoned in the sea the gold that he had borrowed in a box and how it was swallowed”. ከመ፡ ተረከቡ፡ በሣፅነ፡ ወርቅ፡ እም፡ ከርሠ፡ ዓሣ፡ “How the box of gold was extracted from the interior of a fish”. ከመ፡ ተእኀዘ፡ በመረብ፡ ዘውኅጡ፡ ዓሣ፡ “How the fish was caught by a pelican and swallowed”.

miniature.info: Fol. 45v: Clergy celebrating the feast of St. Michael.
miniature.details: Legends: በታቦተ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ቂሶን፡ ዘተሰምየ፡ ማቴዎስ፡ “At the altar of St. Michael Matewos called together his priests“. ከመ፡ ሰምዓ፡ ማኃሌተ፡ እንዘ፡ ይትቀነዩ፡ ካህናት፡ በበዓሉ፡ ለሚካኤል፡ “How he heard the chant that the clergymen chanted for the celebration of the feast of St. Michael”. ማቴዎስ፡ ወከመ፡ ኖመ፡ በአንቀጸ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ “Matewos. And how he slept near the entrance to the church“. እሉ፡ ካህናት፡ “These clergymen“. ከመ፡ ሖረ፡ በሐመር፡ ባሕቲቱ፡ ቅድመ፡ ሀገረ፡ ቆሎንያ፡ “How he went alone by boat through a hot region”.

miniature.info: Fol. 46r: Baptism of Qison.
miniature.details: Legends: ከመ፡ ሖረ፡ ካዕበ፡ ም[ስለ]፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ወውሉዱ፡ በሐመር፡ “How he went, again, with his wife and children by boat“. ወ[ከመ]፡ ረከብዎ፡ እሉ፡ ካህናት፡ “And how he received these clergymen“. ከመ፡ ሐተቶ፡ ጳጳስ፡ “How the Bishop questioned him“. ከመ፡ አጥመቆሙ፡ ለቂሶን፡ ወብእሲቱ፡ ወለውሉዱ፡ ጳጳስ፡ “How the Bishop baptized Qison and his wife and his children”.

miniature.info: Fol. 63v: Two miniatures.
miniature.details: The Creation of the first man (the upper). Legend: ከመ፡ ፈጠሮ፡ ለአዳም፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ “How God created Adam”. The fallen angel (the lower). Legend: ከመ፡ አውረዶ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ለመልአከ፡ ጽልመት፡ መትሕተ፡ ሲኦል፡ “How St. Michael brought down the angel of the darkness into Sheol”.

miniature.info: Fol. 64r: St. Michael kills the Pharaoh and destroys his troops.
miniature.details: Legends: ከመ፡ አብዖ፡ ባነተ፡ ሙሴዐ፡ “How he introduced him the gift of Moses”. ከመ፡ አስጠሞ፡ ለፈፍርዖን፡ በባሕር፡ ምስለ፡ ሠራዊቱ፡ “How he immersed in the sea the Pharaoh with his troops”. ፳ኤል፡ ወሙሳ፡ “The Israelites and Moses”.

miniature.info: Fol. 64v: Moses on the mount of Sinai.
miniature.details: Legend: ከመ፡ ተሰዓሎ፡ ለሙሴ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በደመና፡ እሳተ፡ ሲና፡ “How the God showed himself to Moses in the cloud of fire of Sinai”.

miniature.info: Fol. 65r: St. Gabriel saves the Three Youths in the Fiery Furnace.
miniature.details: Legend: በከመ፡ አድኀኖሙ፡ ገብርኤል፡ ለእናንያ፡ ወአዛርያ፡ ወሚሳኤል፡ “How St. Gabriel saved ʾƎnanya and ʾAzarya and Misaʾel”. Usually St. Michael takes part in this representation.

miniature.info: Fol. 65v: Miniature representing a miracle of St. Michael.
Fol. 66r: Miniature representing a miracle of St. Michael.
Fol. 67v: Last Supper.
miniature.details: Legend: ከመ፡ ረፈቀ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በማዕድ፡ ምስለ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ “How the God sat at the table with the Apostles”.

miniature.info: Fol. 68r: Two miniatures representing a miracle of St. Michael.
miniature.details: Smiths prepare the box for the rich man who was to die in eight days according to the prophecy (the second).

miniature.info: Fol. 73v: St. Michael with a sword, about to strike a prostrate demon (as a part of representation).
Fol. 74r: The rich man who wants to kill the child.
Fols. 75r, 75v: Miniatures representing miracles of St. Michael.
Fol. 76r: St. Michael unsheathing his sword against the army of Sennacherib.
miniature.details: Legends: ቅዱስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ “St. Michael”. ከመ፡ ጸለዩ፡ ሕዝቅደስ፡ ወሠራዊቱ፡ “How Ḥǝzqǝdäs and his troops prayed”. ከመ፡ ኀልቁ፡ ሠራዊተ፡ ሳናክሪም፡ “How the troops of Sennacherib perished”.

miniature.info: Fol. 81v: Two elders seize Susanna.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ አኀዝዋ፡ ረበናት፡ ለሰስና፡ “How the elders seized Susanna”.

miniature.info: Fol. 82r: St. Michael rescues Susanna from the false accuse of the elders.
miniature.details: Legend: ከመ፡ አድኀና፡ ሚካኤል፡ “How St. Michael saved her”. Connected with the previous miniature on fol. 81v.

miniature.info: Fol. 82v: St. Fasilidäs on horseback defeating the Kassites.
miniature.details: Legends: ቅዱስ፡ ፋሲሊደስ፡ “St. Fasilidäs”. ሰብአ፡ ቁዝ፡ “The Kassites”. Usually the scene is connected with St. Theodor.

miniature.info: Fol. 83v: HolyTrinity with the Heavenly Priests.
miniature.details: Legends: እግዚአብሔር፡ “God”. ገጸ፡ ሰብእ፡ “The face of a human being”. ገጸ፡ ንስር፡ “The face of an eagle”. [ገጸ፡ አንበሳ፡] “The face of a lion”. [ገጸ፡ ላህም፡] “The face of an ox”. ካህናተ፡ ሰማይ፡ “The Priests of Heaven“.

miniature.info: Fol. 84r: St. Michael and St. Gabriel.
miniature.details: Legend: ሚካኤል፡ ወገብርኤል፡ “Michael and Gabriel”.

miniature.info: Fol. 84v: St. Michael with the sword.
Fol. 85v: St. Michael with the angels.
Fol. 86r: St. Michael who installs a flag on a kind of a boat.
Fol. 99v: St. Michael, a figure praying in a church and a fish.
Fol. 100r: Seven people in discussion (upper part); a plowman with two oxen (lower part).
Fol. 105v: St. Michael who appears to a man who stays at the church overnight.
Fol. 106r: Miniature representing a miracle of St. Michael.
Fol. 107v: Miniature representing a miracle of St. Michael. Probably parts of different miracles.
Fol. 108r: Miniature representing a miracle of St. Michael.
miniature.details: Probably parts of different miracles.

miniature.info: Fol. 113v: A Holy Warrior on horseback, about to strike the dragon, and a woman behind.
Fol. 114r: The Virgin and Child with two Archangels. A person praying for her help and another one presenting her a flower.
Fol. 119v: Miniature representing a miracle of St. Michael.
miniature.details: A person sleeping near the church.

miniature.info: Fol. 120r: Miniature representing a miracle of St. Michael.
miniature.details: A woman carrying a child and a person praying in a church.

miniature.info: Fol. 121v: The Bishop baptizes Qison.
Fol. 122r: The Bishop with Qison and a woman.
miniature.details: The miniature is connected to the previous ones on fols. 46r, 122r.
